website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for practical, simple speaker stands, these are a fine buy for the price.
pros: The height is adjustable (27 to 48 inches), and they're light enough to travel with
cons: They have a wide base for stability, but when raised particularly high, they can be knocked over if bumped into

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Monoprice 10565
customer_reviews.text: I've been on the lookout for some speaker stands and suffered at BestBuy with one of the Sanus brands which had a faulty screw so couldn't use it at all. It's all good since I ended up getting these guys which are cheaper. Works perfectly for Mono 10565's (  ) Come's with two brackets 4 1/2 inch & 7 inch to help secure speaker with a screw. Also used the 3m double sided adhesive tape to help secure the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Spicy Chips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and perfect for Nakamichi rear surrounds!
customer_reviews.text: Used with Nakamichi 'Shockwafe Elite 7.2' - perfect for the rear surround sound speakers. Feed the audio cable (straight-end first) through all the parts and then assemble; simple, fast and easy. I had both assembled and setup within a half-hour's time. The stands are 'substantial' and the bases have good weight. These are stable and should be very durable. They function perfectly, look good and are 'fully-approved' by the 'Lady-who-lets-me-live-with-Her' 😉
customer_reviews.author: Brett R

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy set up; value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The stands are sturdy. Set up was a breeze. To thread the speaker wires through the stand poles use a shoestring, or a long, thin piece of wire (do this first before attaching pole to base). The satellite speakers attached to the stands are to Vizio's 5.1.2 atmos soundbar system. They are very lightweight, and slightly smaller than a bottle of spring water. I read many reviews where people had issues screwing the speakers to the stands, and having to bend the brackets. I did not bother. I attached the speakers with the 3M tape that comes in the box, and the hold will suffice (pictures attached). I'm very pleased with the stands. Definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Swiszms

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM USED
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this product uses. What I got was a box of trash that was unusable. No screws came with this. Of the one extension bar I recieved the bottom threading to screw it into the stand was sheered off. There was no base plate to set the speakers on. This item literally looks like someone took two hand fulls of what ether was lying in a pile and just dropped them into a box. I cannot speak to the new version of this item, but what I got should have been thrown in the recycling not sent out to someone who paid for it
customer_reviews.author: Cory Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Sonos Play:1 owners, yes, they fit!
customer_reviews.text: Using as rear surround stands for my Sonos Play:1s, if you're reading this you already know how expensive other compatible stands are. These work great, are sturdy, have heavy bases (that I put heavier felt feet on so the rattling won't scratch the hardwood floors), and are height adjustable to fit behind even couches with very high backs. As with anything, tighten hardware firm but not too tight so you avoid stripping anything. Even has fabric strips to stick onto the base plates for the speakers to rest on. Just grab some 1/4 inch-20 metric screws to attach the speakers to the stands.
customer_reviews.author: Your Name Here

customer_reviews.title: No assembly instructions-ridiculous!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first go round with speaker stands, I have assembled lots of stuff so I figured they would be pretty easy to properly assemble right? Oh, not so! With just a parts list, no diagram or assembly instructions, and poorly machined threads on the base/post assembly it really sucked. I wonder why they bothered with the parts list, other than confirming that you have, maybe, all of the parts required it was useless. However I saved it in case I run out of toilet paper. Whoever you are Atlantic you need to include assembly instructions. Maybe some nice customer will document assembly here for you. I will-send the check in advance.
customer_reviews.author: DET

customer_reviews.title: Quality good though color different...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these some 10 years back to mount 2 Bose speakers that has worked well and looked nice ...but recently bought a 2nd set to mount an alternate Polk set to complete the 5.1 setup. Based on make and model, both sets are the same. Structure and sturdiness they are ...but color and logo are different. Color is slightly lighter on newer ones. Would have liked them to be the same, but for overall functionally they are nice and the speakers are small enough that they don't strain the stands or stand out as over-sized warts. When positioned in their specific areas, the differences are not noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Does not have enough hardware for the Nakamichi Shockwafe series speakers
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended on the Nakamichi home page as a good stand for the Shockwafe series speakers. Sadly, there was not enough hardware to correctly mount the speakers. While stands look very stylish, because of their triangular shape, the speakers can tip more easily than a those with a round stand base. That said, the construction was good and yes, they are stylish. Being able to fit the cables down the center of the extendable tube was nice, and there is a notch in the stand base for the cable. Without the hardware difficulties the rating would have been 4.5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with a clean look, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I combined these with  They did not natively fit so I had to purchase some bolts/screws, and a U-Bolt pipe clamp (only for flat piece). I then used some black textured spray paint and assembled everything to look seamless. The close up picture from behind does not look as good as when new but the stands have been moved around to different places a few times as well as a to a new house. As for the stand itself, it has good weight and is unobtrusive. They were $32 after a Lightning Deal in late 2012, have been in constant use since then. Once I upgrade the surround speakers these are going into the bedroom to add surround there.
customer_reviews.author: Grahaminator

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my Vizio 5.1.2 Atmos Soundbar Speakers
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Sturdy base, nice appearance (solid black, not chippable), flexible, and fairly easy to setup. Setup could be simpler, but the minor complexity is because of the flexibility to attach multiple types of speakers. I was left with a number of parts I didn't need, but was able to use the screws that came with my speakers to easily secure them into the stands. It seems to me that just about any speaker could be easily attached to these stands.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Whittle

customer_reviews.title: need a bit of set up work but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: okay you need to read other reviews before assembling! (specifically where the guy talks about grabbing a beer and a set of pliers) these are incredibly sturdy but need a bit of MacGyver-ing to set up. we used them for our VIZIO speakers. used the screws that came with the speakers to wall mount them. and bent the bars on the back around the plug in. make sure to string the correct end of the corn through or it will not fit. also use a shoelace to pull the cord through if needed. the slanted edge of the base is great to tuck under the back of the couch so no one stubs their toe.
customer_reviews.author: KT✨

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my situation!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these stands to use with Vizio 5.1 satellite speakers. They work perfectly with a little widening of the back speaker support wire (it's easily bendable). These speaker stands are adjustable and high enough to go over a high back couch, which is not the case with many of these stands. The bases are heavy and perfectly shaped to slide under the back of the couch, so my kitty cannot pull them over. Just a perfect solution for my situation. The original order was lost in transit bu Amazon made right by it and got them to me 1 week later, 2 days after my call to them.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you have the right kind of speaker
customer_reviews.text: I used these for small surround-sound speakers. They are extremely stable, very attractive and they hold the speakers securely. I have these on a wood floor. I'm not sure that you would get an acceptable result on carpeting. THESE REQUIRE your speakers to have a machine screw cylinder on the back. There are holes on the bottom that would allow you to attach the speakers with wood screws — perhaps — but that might damage the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Eyeconic

customer_reviews.title: Works for my rear/surround speakers
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my Nakamichi 9.2.4 surround speakers and they fit perfectly. I was able to pull the RCA wires thru the middle rod (therefore hiding the cable as intended) and adjust the height easily to ear level. The 3 prong feet looks nice but might have been more stable if it's was 4 prong feet or a square. But I love the aesthetic so I don't mind since it's on hardwood floors. Thick carpet might make it slightly less stable, but I doubt by much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stands, Best I've found!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after seeing another reviewers post that they worked very good with yhe Nakamichi 7.2.4 Shockwafe satellite speakers..These things rock. Built strong with heavy bases (think microphone type stand) to hold the speakers. They are well made, easy to attach and set up. Speaker wire can be ran through stems and they have a nice black matted painted surface. 100% recommend them. Price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.ROESEL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Vizio sound bar surround sound rear speakers ... you just have to buy a couple of metric screws and some washers ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the right stands for the surround sound speakers of the VIZIO SB4551-D5 Smartcast 45” 5.1 Slim Sound Bar System. The speaker connectors WILL fit inside the posts, and the only adjustment you have to make is to put some washers behind the speakers to space them away from the back brace, and purchase some 4 mm screws (at least 30 mm long, or longer) to fasten the washers and speakers to the back brace. They are sturdy, they look nice, and they FIT! I don't understand why others purchase the Sanus stands, because there are many reviews that say the connectors will not fit inside the posts. Moreover, they cost more than these Atlantic stands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better, but they do the job for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to setup. One screw on the speaker holder was not the appropriate size though. Adjustable pole is easy to use. They are pretty stable. They won’t fall over or anything if you brush by them. However, the robot vacuum is able to push the base so they have to be realigned after every cleaning. Note: they are on hardwood floors. Used with rear speakers for Samsung HW-K950
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great stands for Nakamichi ShockWafe 9.2.4 Soundbar system
customer_reviews.text: We purchase these for the Nakamichi ShockWafe 9.2.4 Soundbar system rear speakers and they serve the purpose perfectly. They are sturdy, allow for hiding the speaker wires inside the pole stands, just remember to run the straight end connectors through first. We have 2 surround speakers mounted vertically and the other 2 horizontally for the Dolby Atmos effect. Base is heavy enough for stability. Plenty of mounting hardware and brackets for various screw sizes. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: It fits great with the Vizio SmartCast SB3651
customer_reviews.text: It fits great with the Vizio SmartCast SB3651. I just have to make a little customization to the speaker's holder but nothing complicated. I documented the process in case someone needs it
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Nakamichi Shockwafe speakers
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased the Nakamichi Elite soundbar system from Best Buy, I also purchased a set of the suggested speaker stands (Sanus model EFSAT-B1 for $89.99). In themselves, the stands were nice and came with various parts to accommodate any number of speaker variations but the holes would only work with your standard "speaker" wires. The Nakamichi uses RCA cables and the input plugs are too big. However, these stands are constructed such that you can run at least the subwoofer input end of the RCA cable down the stand. The stand is extremely easy to set up and attach the speakers and the quality of the construction seems superior to the Sanus speakers, yet these were less than $40.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Rock Steady
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking design, very heavy base to counterbalance the speakers. All metal parts(!) mean that there will be no stress fractures at critical points where the speaker attaches to the stand (take that, monoprice)!. For the price, these are excellent, although assembly is a slight challenge with the unique way you attach the speaker clip to the stand. But it also means a fairly universal fit and sturdy grip. I put my Anthony Gallo satellites on these stands, and it looks pretty cool, overall.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Carden

customer_reviews.title: I am going to buy a better set for my Sonos
customer_reviews.text: These are advertised as being compatible with the Sonos Play-1. If by compatible they mean that the Sonos has a 1/4-20 threaded receptacle in the back and these come with 1/4-20 screws, then yes they are compatible. However, the screws are to long. They are 3/4 of an inch in length. This means that the speaker does not snug tightly to the stand. Also, the hollow stem is to narrow to accommodate the head on the songs power cord. The stand appears to be stable. I got what I paid for and I'll keep them, but I will probably end up using them for secondary speakers. I am going to buy a better set for my Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: BobMc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product but narrow holes for power cord. Doesn't work with Q9OR.
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised that people who reviewed it earlier said this product works with Samsung Q90R. Well, it does only partially. The paper cord doesn't fit through the stand as you can see in the pictures from either end, which means it will not go through the pipe and instead hangs outside. If you are okay with that, you can buy this. Dangling wires ruin the entire look. The product is cast iron and is very sturdy. Great balance and poor workmanship. Clearly the QA is not efficient. Sadly will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Bharat Mantha

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have Vizio speaker and the speaker wire has a plug on them. This creates a situation where you have to adjust the metal part that the speaker attaches to. Doesn't take much time but does create some install situations. Also, if you want to put the speaker wire thru the stand make it easy on yourself, take the stand apart(comes in two) then put the wiring thru the stand. Makes life a lot easier. They are good quality. I knew when I bought them that I would have the install situation due to my Vizio speakers having a plug.
customer_reviews.author: jeff yaro

customer_reviews.title: Nice stands but they don't work well with Vizio satellite speakers
customer_reviews.text: Quality metal stands but they do not work with my Vizio satellite speakers without substantial modifications( I hear this is common with Vizio). If your speaker has an RCA with a 90 degree connector, you cannot run the wire through the stand. I had to bend the bracket that secures the speaker so the RCA could seat. I also had to get new hardware since the screws that came with the speakers were too short and the stands did not supply this hardware. All in all I should have kept looking for stands that were compatible with my Vizio Smartcast wi-fi Sound Bar System (38", 5.1) mainly due to the wire not fitting through the stand.
customer_reviews.author: August West

customer_reviews.title: Works with Nakamichi satellites but a real pain to use them on their sides
customer_reviews.text: If you want your satellites to point at the couch, this is a great stand. If you want to lay them on their side and have the speak face up towards the ceiling, for Atmos, with a lot of tinkering and fiddling with wires and screwing the wire loop on and off and things falling to floor, you can make it work. But...
customer_reviews.author: jjnbos

customer_reviews.title: Beefy!
customer_reviews.text: Good set of stands (purchased 2 sets = 4 pcs.). Better half was concerned that they would "interfere with the décor"! They almost disappear amongst the furniture. Assembly was fairly easy and straight forward....most difficult part was fishing the speaker wire thru the tube. Heavy base makes them sturdy...the cats can't even knock them over. Without adjusting the height, they sit at a perfect level for when we're sitting on the couch. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Martin R

customer_reviews.title: These stands are so much better than I had anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding! These stands are so much better than I had anticipated! Just perfect in every way. I'm using them with Vizio surrounds and its a perfect marriage. Everything you need is supplied so assembly is a breeze. There is some small amount of jury rigging needed but it so simple a child can handle it! Face it folks there is no one size fits all but this is as close as you can come! End result is a perfect fit with a modicum of adjustment. Some reviewers that are better teachers than I have outlined what to do for the perfect fit use their tips I sure did. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DozaTop Contributor: Ukuleles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these speaker stands for several reasons; quality, price, they looked nice, they fit out Visio brand speakers, the wires could be fed through the stands, and the base of the speakers could slide under the couch. When my husband was putting them together he thought I spent a fortune on them, because of the quality and stability.
customer_reviews.author: M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Used this pair of speaker stands with the Vizio SB4051-D5 ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this pair of speaker stands with the Vizio SB4051-D5 sound bar system. Unlike previous reviewers, I didn't need to splice the wires or modify the speaker stands in any way. I just fished the straight end of the speaker wire plug with dental floss through the speaker stand poles. The L-shaped end plugs into the speaker. I didn't use the hardware included with the speaker stands to mount the speaker. I used the doubled-sided tape that came with the speaker stands. I figured that the speakers are light enough that the tape will hold them just enough on the stands.
customer_reviews.author: CMUboy

customer_reviews.title: Great Match for Klipsch Quintet V's.
customer_reviews.text: These stands are alot nicer than I expected, and leave nothing to be asked for. Extra parts provided for different size speakers. Mine are holding Klipsch Quintet V front and rear speakers and look great doing so. (Earlier Klipsch Quintet II's will not be compatible due to the angled mount on the back corner of the speakers.)
customer_reviews.author: oZmonKey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stands.
customer_reviews.text: Great stands and look good in the home theater. Took two min to setup. Reason for four instead of five stars is that the provided speaker screws are too long leaving the speakers loose on the stand. I sourced some appropriate length hardware to sort that little issue. The poles can support up to 12 gauge speaker wire though it takes some patients getting the wire through the top where the speaker sits. Overall great units.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, however...
customer_reviews.text: These stands are surprisingly heavy duty, especially for the price. If you have small satellite speakers like I do (Visio 5.1), you will have to make a compromise. If you value the look, then you will need to clip the wire mounts and shorten them up to be flush with the pad. I just moved the speaker back so the wire mount doesn’t extend past the speaker mount base.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dingman

customer_reviews.title: Decent stands for surround speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hold a pair of Acoustic Audio AA321B Surround Speakers that I purchased as back surround for my 7.1 system. Assembly was easy and although the speakers I bought didn't have a mounting screw, I was able to adapt their wall mounts to hold these speakers with no issue. They have a decent weight and feel sturdy. The speakers I have are very light, but I think these would be stable with some heavier speakers. I like the fact that you can run the wires through the base, pole, and mount. I'm running 14-guage wire and there were no issues with getting it run through the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for larger speakers
customer_reviews.text: Previously ordered the sanus stands with the curve at the top and those were unbalanced and too short to get to the desirred height of ear level for my Nakamichi Elite 7.2's The rear speakers weight roughly about 4lbs and they site nicely on these stands, no wobble or topple feel to them and the material feels industrial. Have no complains so far, my ears are happy and my wife says she likes it so it's a win win in my living room. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: WarrenH

customer_reviews.title: Mounting was rough but functional
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited when I purchased these. I have a Vizio sound system, and these mounts work but aren't perfect. Pros: Good quality Very stable Cons: The wire speaker back supports are too narrow (I had to bend them to plug in the speaker cables) The wire speaker back supports are too long. Functionally not bad, but it doesn't look nice. The raw edges of the wire stick past the front of the mounting plate. Insufficient mounting hardware The stands come with three screw sizes. Two different sizes for the speakers, and one for the stands themselves. The ones that fit my speakers are the ones required to assemble the stand itself. Had to go purchase extra screws.
customer_reviews.author: WingsOverEden

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for VIZIO SB3851 5.1 Sound Bar System
customer_reviews.text: Speaker stands are as described by seller, received in good condition and before estimated delivery date. I have VIZIO SB3851-D0 SmartCast38” 5.1 Sound Bar System and I was looking for compatible speaker stands. While assembling these stands was easy but passing an RCA speaker cable thru metal tube was a task however it does fit thru the tube. The bolt-on screws supplied were large so I had to use Vizio supplied screws to bolt the speakers on the stand. Like the fact that these are height adjustable. Overall, a good addition to living room!
customer_reviews.author: Nishant

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for the price! Originally bought the "mount it" 4 pack...they were absolute garbage...arrived with a broken piece and only 2 of the 4 I ordered. Returned those for these. Soooooo much better. These actually include 2 mounting bars so I was able to use the longer ones to mount the Energy take home classics with absolutely no problem...you don't have to turn them upside down...perhaps they didn't used to include both of the sizes of the mounting hardware which is why people used to have problems. They are solid and sturdy even up at the highest point. My speakers only weigh about 2.2lbs so I can't speak for larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Vizio Speakers with a bit of modification.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the popular Vizio surround speakers. the Cords of the Vizio is kind thick and was able to go though the stand poles. Although one thing... I had to actually cut the metal attachments that stick up and allow you to screw on the to speaker cause the speaker is kinda small compared to a regular surround speaker; the metal bottom peice stood out a lot. So you'll might need some cutting pliers if you don't want metal sticking out of the bottom. See the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy stands!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are very heavy duty and sturdy speaker stands. The tubing is wide enough to allow an audio cable with an RCA plug go through the center to keep it hidden. These are a great upgrade to my older cheaper stands. I highly recommend these stands! They are worth a few extra buck for their sturdiness!
customer_reviews.author: cldsk

customer_reviews.title: Check the materials first
customer_reviews.text: Decent bargain. I got the Vizio 5.1 soundbar which has tiny satellite speakers. These are a bit overkill for that. The screws provided are too big so I used the wall mount screws that came with the soundbar and had to flex the bar a little bit around the back to allow the plug to seat. Also tied some string around the plug and fed that thru first to get the wire through the tube. Instructions are kind of out of order in my opinion so do a dry run first before locking down screws or applying the adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: B. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The base is nowhere near heavy enough to counter the weight of a speaker on top. Set these up 1 week ago and they have already fallen over 3 times. Looks bad if you dont have them covered with their backs against a wall, the wires are exposed coming out the back. The single screw with which to attach your speaker was not enough to keep my speakers held up and now they awkwardly balance on the frame and are also screwed on at an angle (my speakers are not cubes and don't have 90° angles on the back).
customer_reviews.author: Snake Plissken

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good... but...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. 5 stars for build quality. I knocked off a star because there should be more measurements and pictures for the mounting dimensions, slots, holes and spaces on the of the stand. Luckily I'm mechanically inclined enough to have figured out a way to finagle the included mounting hardware to my speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and easy to hook the wires through. My wife wouldn't tolerate anything that overwhelmed the room and these work great. I use them with the Vizio 5.1 satellites - which are very small but powerful speakers. I initially tried to use the back brace (as folks say, you do have to stretch them) but they stood out over the speakers and that didn't make sense. So I've used the two-sided sticker tape that's provided which is more than fine for speakers that are sitting well back in the corner of my family room where no one is going to bump into them. Highly recommend for the value and look.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Fits in great for my Polk satellite speakers !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speaker stands few days back and I love it ! I have used them for my Polk satellite speakers and they fit in well. The design is good too and each pack includes two sets of stands. The only reason why I did not give 5 stars is because of the stubborn height adjustment knob on the body of the stand. Upon tightening the knob, I found it extremely difficult to loosen it again a couple of times. Otherwise this is a great product and best value for money. I bought two pairs of these for front and back speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Saj

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely put together and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Given the price of other speaker stands I've looked in to, these were great. My only two complaints were not enough assortment of screws, but I can see how that would end up being too difficult to keep up with by the mfg and then the wire hoop loop that supports the speaker is a little narrow. You have you pry it a little for back screw mounted speakers.. It's nothing a few moments with pliers can't fix though. All in all, these are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: HumanWiki

customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy u can tell it was made to hold heavy speakers u can hide the cables really well and has several different ways on how to mount ur speakers. I have the vizio 5.1 (old 2015 edition) and cables fit no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jinzo96

customer_reviews.title: Looks like quality!
customer_reviews.text: The notion that they are top heavy is incorrect. They’re plenty sturdy. I bought them used but I estimate the original buyer didn’t want the hassle of putting them all together because everything still had the plastic protection around all the loose parts. Final products is stylish and functional. I give them A- (A minus)
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN T. WRIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Been quite satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.text: Great little stands! I have 5lb Klipsch Synergy S-10 Premium speakers on them and they've been working well so far. My only complaint is they can be knocked over pretty easily with 5lb speakers on them. If the base was heavier, it would help alleviate this. I used double-sided 3M mounting tape and the speakers have held-fast even with a few tip-overs. I'd recommend placing these out of the way if possible since you can easily brush past and knock them over with top heavy speakers. Overall I'm very satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice stands
customer_reviews.text: These are a good alternative to wall mounting speakers. it is nice that they can be easily moved for cleaning around. The stands can take a pretty good sized speak. I would recommend them to family and friend.
customer_reviews.author: DarkRider-62

customer_reviews.title: I love these stands.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stands. I was able to attach my Visio satellite speakers as others have noted; by cutting the brackets a little bit. The speakers sit perfectly, without any wires showing. They've been in my house for months, and no one has noticed the adjustments I made to the brackets - it is completely hidden. I also took another reviewer's advice, and used a black Sharpie to cover over the exposed metal, after trimming the brackets.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light weight satellite speakers
customer_reviews.text: Flexible install in vertical or horizontal with extra parts, perfect for my satellite surround speaker under five pounds, Amazon subwoofer RCA cable (single and thick) hiding inside the pole without issue.
customer_reviews.author: helloandy

customer_reviews.title: Great Build Quality.
customer_reviews.text: The built quality is really something you don't see often these days. The entire unit has the feel and weight of cast iron. Came with some protective pads so the bottoms don't scratch up any hardwood floors as well. While I'm giving these five stars for the item itself, they do not fit my VIZIO S4251w-B4 system's sattelite speakers perfectly. I had to find some creative means to get them to screw into the speakers and keep everything in place. Once done, however, you cannot notice my McGuyvering that took place.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Speaker Stands
customer_reviews.text: Bought these speaker stands for my Vizio speakers. I knew ahead of time that some people had issues with mounting Vizio speakers on these stands. I decided to buy them anyway as they are a good price and were listed as universal speaker stands. I had some difficulty with securing the speakers to the stands but was able to get them situated correctly. The screws on the back don't fit well but I am still happy with the overall appearance. If you are willing to fiddle with them a little, these speaker stands are a great option for your home theatre set up.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent with my VIZIO S4251w-B4 soundbar satellite speakers
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent with my VIZIO S4251w-B4 soundbar satellite speakers. The included cables DO fit inside the stand as many have stated. I had to use the long L brackets because the shorter ones stuck out too far in the front under the speaker. I used the screws from the speaker package and the smaller washers, I think, that came with the stands. The base of the stand is very heavy and sturdy - I feel comfortable that they won't easily tip over - and the height is super easy to adjust. I have them positioned behind my couch which is in the middle of a large room (not against a wall). So glad I found these stands!
customer_reviews.author: PAL

customer_reviews.title: I still own these and use these
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these stands many years ago and they are still holding up all of my speakers. I plan on eventually replacing all of the speakers, but, these stands will still be used. ATLANTIC ADJUSTABLE HEIGHT SPEAKER STANDS FOR LIFE!
customer_reviews.author: The Illist

customer_reviews.title: Gr8 for tall speakers with support screw at 7+" from the base.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the stands for the TALL (10" height total - 5" screw height from the base) surround sound speakers for SONY HT RT5 from Costco (not available in other chains - a British model) - they are truly wireless system with no connections for the surround sound system. The taller bracket was able to accommodate the 10" tall speakers - the height of the bracket is close to 8". the base is 2.5" square and the speakers do not wobble. it is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ravichandran M. Kaushika

customer_reviews.title: Stuck a Sony SS-B1000 on these..
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how well a 6lb bookshelf speaker would hold on these but its does. Just stuck them on with the supplied 3M tape and its good to go. If its extended too tall it may topple over if you bump into it. Don't do that.
customer_reviews.author: Aneil Raghunanan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for what I needed them for (Vizio SB3651-E6 Satellite Speakers). Only complaint I have is that the back bracket to hold the speaker up that you are supposed to be able to plug the chord through is too small to fit. Only update needed in my opinion. Other than that, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit Klipsch speakers (or any speaker taller than 4 inches)
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Very sturdy product Cons: Brackets are TINY. I got these for the rear speakers in my surround setup. These stands come with 2 sets of brackets. The largest set is roughly 4-4.5 inches long. If you have anything other than baby speakers, it is unlikely for them to fit. One other note: I bought these after seeing someone else's review where they fit larger speakers. I'm thinking there may be 2 different models of the same stand being sold. Either that or they don't consistently measure the brackets.
customer_reviews.author: o'le

customer_reviews.title: Great stands for my satellite speaker system
customer_reviews.text: These satellite speakers are sturdy and tough, able to remain stable while holding my two speakers. I had to go buy some special screws and washers to fabricate my own mounting and I used the taller and longer rear supports for mounting my speakers. I didn't bother using the double stick tape because I wanted to be able to remove and disassemble in the future. The double stick tape pretty much makes it a messy disassembly task if used. The base has a nice weight to keep the speakers stable without feeling too heavy for general moving around.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my surround sound speakers
customer_reviews.text: This product is durable and the base is heavy to prevent tipping. Had to slightly bend the support behind the speaker to allow the Vizio cord to fit to allow the speaker to sit flush and screw in but it worked out fine. We did return our Vizio because we had several issues with it (that’s another headache). Waiting for our JBL soundbar system to arrive to see how that will work with these stands.
customer_reviews.author: NU

customer_reviews.title: Good stands, had to work around to put my speakers, but I was able to fit them
customer_reviews.text: They work as intended, you do have to know which surround speakers you are using this for because some surround speakers will not work on this stand. Make sure your speakers have at least a hole screw in the back. My speakers didn't have a hole in the back, but I was able to work around it because I have a very good imagination for this kind of stuff. So now you know, if you are buying these stands, make sure you are surround speakers have something to screw on to in the back not the bottom like mine did (unless you are good a working around this issue).
customer_reviews.author: T. Toribio

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker stands does the job. I bought the Vizio SB4051 (from Costco). It works well with these Vizio satelitte speakers. The right size. I agree with some of the other reviews about the mounting the speakers. However, it was not that difficult, just expand the bars (see my picture) and push them back together hold the speakers in place. Some might see that as being only 4 stars but either way. It works really with my Vizio, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: dtducla

customer_reviews.title: definitely worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, heavy construction, fairly easy to feed wires through and install. Maybe a bit short of elegant, but they look good in my family room - even wife hasn't complained about them. I have these sitting on carpet with no concerns about them falling over and find the heights are easily adjustable. Did have to work a little bit to get my vizio surround sound speakers to fit. Small pliers is all you need, and maybe a hack saw if the brackets are too long for your speakers. For me, instead of hacking off the extra metal from the bracket (my speakers were a bit small I guess), I just bent it down towards the base.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: High Expectations, but fell short.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to set up our surround sound system. I recently also purchased my vizio SB4051-D5 soundbar system. While setting it up I realized that the stands were way too big for the speakers. The mount is too big and the wired brace that holds in place sticks out. If I center the speaker, then the wires will stick out too much. I included pictures and I am hoping that Atlantic will help me solve this problem. Now the speaker sets off centered and the mount shows a lot. The wires stick out and I am hoping my young ones don't hurt themselves or scrap their eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Vaksen

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: These stands were perfect fit for my Nachamichi Shockwave surround speakers. The mounting holes on the speakers aligned perfectly with the speakers. The design allows you to run the speaker cable inside the stand. Great Product
customer_reviews.author: Jim Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Fast Install, Versatile install options and looks good.
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, and worked with our little sony speaker's, the speaker stands came with two sized threads and one set threaded fine into our little mini-surround sound speaker set we had for the kids Xbox 360. Our speakers were a bit small so they sit on the stands and have a bit of the stand hanging over so it's not exactly "pretty" for smaller speaker styles. Fast install, easy to explain instructions and the options for installation was easy to read. I'll save all the information on installation kit and what it works with as some of the other reviews covered it well (which is why I chose to buy these).
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Schommer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't allow me to hide the wires and front of the speaker mount is gaudy.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simple, they hold the speakers just fine, but there are parts of the speaker holder sticking out of the front. I may try to trim off the excess from it. Also attempting to feed the speaker wire/plug through almost resulted in ruining the speaker wire itself since the plug was a right angle plug. I'd suggest creating the pole in a slightly larger diameter...
customer_reviews.author: DDR

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY stands compatible with the Vizio soundbar 5.1 speaker system
customer_reviews.text: If you have the Vizio soundbar 5.1 speaker system and just trying to find a compatible stand... you have come to the right place. The Vizio speaker cord ends are uniquely shaped, which makes it impossible to insert into the poles of the stand. Thankfully they fit just fine through these stands. You will need to stretch out the metal brackets at the top but it's easy to do with your hands. If you kept the speaker screws that came with your Vizio then those are perfect, otherwise hopefully you have some spare screws that may fit.The ones that come with the stands won't work. Heavy base is great and they're sturdy stands. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: HenryTanaka

customer_reviews.title: Good quality stand but had to do some mod-ing to make it fit my Vizio SB3851-C0 sound bar set up.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction and seems like very nice quality, the only problem is that I used it for the Vizio SB3851-C0, and the mounting rods don't fit quite right because the plug for the speaker that goes into the back is large and doesn't fit like it should on the speaker stands. I had to bend them to make them work, ALSO if you plan of using it with the Vizio SB3851-C0 you cannot use the screws that came with the speaker stands....luckily I kept the screws that came with my Vizio speakers and they obviously fit.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Unstable, one of the threads on the mounting plate for the rider pole was stripped and would not tighten so the speaker would swivel on its own sometimes. would not buy
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Chau

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and have good stability
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and have a good stability. First read carefully the notice. Check the fixing points on your speaker first before choosing the corresponding fasteners for fixing. It is good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Konan Ngoran

customer_reviews.title: Speaker stands, what's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the Logitec speakers to raise the front and rear speakers up. Close to the floor, I couldn't hear as well. They do their job, and inexpensive. They look nice too, along with the rest of everything. I bought 2 more for another set of speakers to add to the system, or for when I upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: W. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Quick trip to Home Depot for a couple missing items
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the reviews when used with the Vizio satellite speakers you’ll need M4 0.7 x 25mm screws which are not provided. I found rubber washers in Home Depot plumbing, 3/8M Flat Washers 21/38” OD, used the shorter “L” brackets with one washer outside and 3 inside to get the spacing needed for the cable plug.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick R Smith Jr

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stands at a nice price!
customer_reviews.text: These stands are very well-built and easy to assemble. They are sturdy even on carpet for most small satellite speakers. I used them with the following speaker set and they work great. The stands are hollow so you can hide the speaker wire. The height is easily adjustable with no tools. The only reason I took off 1 star is because they don't offer many different mounting options. The included mounts work fine for the speakers above, but they might not work for all satellite speakers depending on the size, shape and location of the screw-holes. The stands are metal, with a heavy base, so they should be strong enough to support most satellite speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Am@zon Stinks

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy stands
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and sturdy stands that is a great choice if you have the right speakers! Unfortunately the speakers I got didn't fit these (eventhough I found them on the "people who bought this also bought" option-thing from where I bought my speakers). You can hide the cable inside the stand, making your living room, or wherever you put them, look cleaner. The base on the bottom is very sturdy and I'm tempted to say these will stand upright if you try to push them over. And last, the most important feature, and the reason they don't work with my speakers: Speakers must be mounted on the back and not the bottom!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eskil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with Vizio soundbar rear surround speakers!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Vizio s4251w-b4 42" 5.1 sound bar system and these stands are just right. You can pass the Vizio speaker wires through the poles of these stands for a clean look. They're a snug fit, but gravity and patience and a little shaking will get them through. The Vizio speaker wire connector is a bit wider than the space in the stand allows for, but I followed advice in another post and just spread the stand connector a tiny bit. The shorter stand connector was just the right height to reach the screw holes provided on the back of the Vizio speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn H.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cheap and surprisingly nice for the money.  Very impressed.  Lots of mounting options.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to mount my rear Sony surrounds, and was aiming at low price because frankly, I just wanted them mounted... I was expecting something cheap that would do the job. But wow. Just... wow. These stands are as sturdy as any of my mic stands I use on the road, and have a nice solid steel base. The look when the speakers are mounted is nothing short of perfect. I hope they last, and since they just sit there, I'm sure they will. Look no further, these stands are the best for the price... I would have expected to spend almost $100 for a pair of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: jcTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Vizio speakers fits perfectly ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stands. My Vizio speakers fits perfectly. Other customers says this doesn't fit or require modifications to use with Vizio, not my case. Fits perfectly, seems sturdy and great quality. Order shipped quickly and arrived in perfect condition. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Raphael Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Not good for medium size speakers. The prongs break and there are better alternatives. It's a very delicate & not Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The one thing that's great about these is the base, it's pretty stable. Do not buy this product if you have medium size or above speakers. It falls over and can break your speakers, and the copper lines. I shredded the screws which are very delicate. The u shape prongs do not hold the speaker right. So for this product I give a 2 stars and for this one I give 5 stars: Just spend the extra money instead of going for a cheap product. The 'VideoSecu 2 Heavy duty PA DJ Club Adjustable Satellite Speaker Stand MS07B M99' is what I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Basic Stands
customer_reviews.text: These stands are great for the price. They where very easy to assembly however; they are not for large speakers. The VIZIO S4251w-B4 5.1 Soundbar with Wireless Subwoofer and Satellite Speakers work great with them and you won't need anything but the side tape provided. The speakers will take on but they're not secure only because of the cables. You can secure these speakers with the mounting screws that come with VIZIO should help. If you do have this sound bar you will have to work to get the speaker cable to get them through the stand but it's workable. Lastly, the iron base & stand will last for some time & it was a great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: They really are cast iron! My vizio 5.1 speakers fit.The only issue is that it will not screw into the back of the speakers with the screw issued.My speakers are very lightweight so I just wrapped the speaker wire around the bracket. If it falls off ,the wire will support it.Not only that ,the bottom of the speaker has a sticky surface that keeps it in place.I probably should distract points ,but ,I won't.Look's good, easy to put together, great price, solid as a rock.Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: More than happy...great product..
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are very sturdy and pretty much perfect for my vizio 5.1 system..the brackets don't naturally fit so you're gonna have to expand the bottom and squeeze the top wit some needle nose pliers but the metal bends very easily...OR you can use the double sided tape. Also in order to get the wires through the tube you have to put the straight connector in first and thread it to the subwoofer..the L shaped connector won't work. Only reason I didn't give a five is because I had to manipulate a bit but overall they're great
customer_reviews.author: Davren N.

customer_reviews.title: Good stands!
customer_reviews.text: Great stands! I wish the adhesive on the top was just a rubber seal instead of double sided adhesive foam. If you have to remove speakers from them they rip and tear and make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Klein

customer_reviews.title: These are SUPER solid and heavy with great connectors
customer_reviews.text: These are SUPER solid and heavy with great connectors that don't rattle even at very high volumes. They work with any speakers. Tip: Thread the speaker wire through first and assemble without tightening until you get your final placement of the stand/speaker as it is a pain to change locations of the stand due to the wire length being fixed. You'll see what I mean when you're installing ;). Can't recommend these high enough and they are my new go-to stands for any installs I do for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED
customer_reviews.text: Had just taken my new surround sound theater system when these came in the mail. Easy to put together, well made, and keeps me from drilling more holes in my walls...
customer_reviews.author: Edubb

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker stands
customer_reviews.text: These stands work perfectly with the satellite speakers for. They're heavy duty and look nice and are very stable. For the price they are unbeatable. Tied a light weight string to a ball point pen and dropped pen through the center post, then tied one end of string to speaker wire and pulled it through which made setup easy! The L-bracket did need slight bending apart in the middle to accomodate the speaker plug but other than that no modifications were necessary for my system.
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the quality but make sure your handy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality speaker stands at a great price. I added these units to my current home theater setup and have to say was pretty impressed at how well built they are. The one issue i had was that my Vizio speakers screw holes would not fit the supplied screws. Also there are NO instructions on how to set this up. Luckily i am very handy and i figured it out but can see someone who doesn't have that skill necessarily have a hard time trying to figure out how to put this thing together especially where the speakers sit.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gerardi

customer_reviews.title: Great option for Logitech z906 surround speakers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height range for surround sound speakers. I bought two sets one for front and one for rear. Easy assembly, plenty sturdy for my z906 surround speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Generally good product.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes a bit unstable but it gets the job done for the most part. I like that the bases are a bit heavy and keep things well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Dcubs

customer_reviews.title: Supports 5 lbs!!
customer_reviews.text: These hold 5 pounds! It's right on the box. I ordered different stands because amazon has these listed as only holding up to 2 pounds and my speakers are 4.6 lbs. My brother bought some and when I saw the held up to 5 lbs I orders these immediatly. I could not be happier at the quality and visual appeal of these stands! However I did have to buld some slightly longer rod supports for my particular speakers (Boston Acoustics A 2310HTS which sound awsome!) which was no problem for me. These look great in the living room. I cannot recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for Nakamichi Soundwafe 9.2.4 Atmos speakers
customer_reviews.text: They fit and work well no issues with install. If I have to pick something to make these better I would say that the base could be a little heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tangalin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for the Vizio S5451w
customer_reviews.text: It really isn't designed for the S5451, but you can make it work with the original parts from the S5451. It ends up being tight enough where the speakers don't move.
customer_reviews.author: twinturbonet

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I think for the money they should not scrimp on screws. I mean it’s almost 40 bucks. Washers more than TWO. Aside from that solid buy
customer_reviews.author: Unit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband Vizio 38" surround sound speakers. He did not have issues with it. The cord from the surround sound fits through the pole. The stand has a good weight to keep the speakers from tilting over. Husband thought the bottom stand was plastic but it's not. He used command strip to hold the speakers down. He did not use the adhesive strips that came with it because he did not want to ruin his speakers or leave residue. Excellent!! Husband is happy with the prduct.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Great Stands
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my Vizio 5.1 Sound Bar System. For this application, it requires a little finesse to mount the speakers with the plug of the wire, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Miovech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stands, almost perfect for my speakers, fantastic customer support
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Solidly built with plenty of height adjustement. One thing is that my Onkyo speakers are very tall and the metal loop that secures it to the base isn't tall enough to secure to the stand. However, the double sided tape is plenty strong to hold it in place since, in general, speakers this size tend not to be too heavy. I had a problem with 2 of the 4 bases (as I ordered 2 sets) having stripped holes where the pole connects. But their customer support was extremely friendly, understanding, and very helpful. They're sending me 2 new bases for the stands, no questions asked. Could not be happier with my experience!
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Would probably work great with some speakers
customer_reviews.text: I got no use from these as I was expecting them to come with a standard "screw-in" connection to the speaker (yamaha NS-AW150WH). Didn't work for me, despite spending over an hour with the instructions thinking "it really can't be this hard". I ended up connecting them using the supplied two-sided tape, which lasted all of three days on my outside, in the hot sun installation. These stands quickly made their way to the trash can. Would probably work great with some speakers, but not mine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Staley

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive stands, but with limitations.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these stands, hoping they would support a small, but expensive supertweeter. Unfortunately, despite conferring with a company representative to confirm the size of the base to support the speaker, I was given erroneous information. The base is actually only about 3 inches square, rather than the stated 6 inches. Therfore, it will support only the tiniest of speakers, unless they have threaded screw sockets in their bases to permit a larger speaker to be secured. Consequently, I returned them for a full, and very prompt refund from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

product_meta.title: Atlantic Adjustable Height Speaker Stands Black - Set of 2 Holds Satellite Speakers, Adjustable Stand Height from 27 to 48 inch, Heavy Duty Powder Coated Aluminum with Wire Management PN77305018
product_meta.description: Charcoal matte color finish universal Speaker Stands. Heavy Duty Iron Cast Construction Provides Durability and Stability.
feature_bullets: Dimensions 11.5" W x 10.5" D x 49.25" H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,018 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
